米軍Ｆ１６戦闘機、コンクリート製の模擬弾を民有地に落とす

07 Nov 2019, 04:03

　６日午後６時３７分頃、在日米軍三沢基地所属のＦ１６戦闘機が、青森県三沢市と六ヶ所村にまたがる訓練施設「三沢対地射爆撃場」から西に約５キロ・メートル離れた民有地に模擬弾を落下させていたことが７日、防衛省への取材で分かった。在日米軍から防衛省に連絡があった。民有地は空き地で、家屋への被害やけが人などの情報はないという。
　防衛省によると、落下したのは精密誘導弾の模擬弾で、コンクリート製のため爆発する恐れはないという。落下した場所は六ヶ所村内で、防衛省職員らが落下した際に地面にできたと思われる穴を確認した。
　事故を受け、在日米軍司令部は防衛省に対し、三沢基地では当面、模擬弾の投下訓練を見合わせると伝えてきているという。防衛省東北防衛局は７日、在日米軍三沢基地に対し、「安全管理の徹底、原因究明、再発防止に努めてほしい」と申し入れを行った。

US Army F16 fighter drops concrete ammunition on private land

07 Nov 2019, 04:03

Around 6:37 pm on the 6th, the F16 fighter belonging to the Misawa base in the US Army is about 5 km west from the training facility “Misawa Anti-Ground Bombing Field” that spans Misawa City and Rokkasho Village in Aomori Prefecture. It was found on the 7th by interviewing the Ministry of Defense that a simulated bullet had been dropped on private land. The US military in Japan contacted the Ministry of Defense. Private land is vacant and there is no information about damage to houses or injuries.
According to the Ministry of Defense, it was a simulated precision bullet that was dropped and made of concrete, so there was no danger of explosion. The place where it fell was in Rokkasho Village, and when the officials of the Ministry of Defense dropped a hole that was thought to have been formed on the ground.
In response to the accident, the US military headquarters in Japan has told the Ministry of Defense that the Misawa Air Base will foresee the launch of simulated ammunition for the time being. The Tohoku Defense Bureau of the Ministry of Defense made a request to the Misawa base in the U.S. Forces in Japan on the 7th that "I would like you to make thorough safety management, investigate the cause, and prevent recurrence."
